commit.message:
Spooky October Bugfix (#587)

This is a fairly comprehensive (and spooky!) üêõüíÄ update resolving many
open issues.

### Arabic bugfixes
- [x] Closes #532 üëª - Additional positional variants added
- [x] Closes #535 üçÇ - Corrected hamza form
- [x] Closes #540 üéÉ - Dot arrangement corrected
- [x] Closes #541 üßπ - Was due to the use of anchors on those glyphs.
  These have been removed so the glyph can render as spacing.
- [x] Closes #542 üåï - This was partly due to a [bug in Harfbuzz]. It
  has been resolved both on the font side (through a different
  implementation) and in Harfbuzz. 
- [x] Closes #549 ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è - Design corrected
- [x] Closes #555 üíÄ - All letter glyphs removed from Arabic
  Presentation form unicode slots to avoid situations where the glyphs
  are not behaving as expected.
- [x] Related to #543 - uni0615 removed as Cascadia Arabic not intended
  to support Quranic

### Other bug fixes
- [x] Closes #488 üî™ - Finally made the www ligature have the proper
  number of `w`s. 
- [x] Closes #436 üßü‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è - Extended length of Powerline 'caps' to
  avoid situations where rounding can prevent overlap. This may cause
  problems if the caps are used next to one another, but that seems an
  unlikely scenario given what I've reviewed of Powerline styles. 
- [x] Closes #521 ü§ñ - enlarged the size of the grave character to make
  it more recognizable / legible in code. 
- [x] Closes #524 ‚ò†Ô∏è - Added some more differentiation in stroke, and
  also created more space using hinting. 
- [x] Closes #525 üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è - tweaked the braces to be more twisty and
  create better differentiation from the parens. 
- [x] Closes #529 üßõ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è - Changed year :P
- [x] Closes #546 üëπ - ij no longer masquerading as a mark. 
- [x] Closes #563 üßü‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è - corrected `locl` feature for proper
  Serbian rendering
- [x] Closes #571 ü¶π‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è - corrected overshoot
- [x] Closes #572 üï∑ - ratio symbol added
- [x] Closes #577 üçÅ - shifted heights of box drawing lines to better
  align with block glyphs. Will reduce risk of non-joining forms under
  certain conditions. 

[bug in harfbuzz]: https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/3069#issuecomment-888472442

commit.message:
Don't leak an open file handle; fix Pyling R1732 (#584)

**The problem**
The code had a case of a manual file handler pitfall, where a resource stream is opened manually and never closed.

This pitfall was detected using Pyling, which triggered a message of code R1732 with the content "Consider using 'with' for resource-allocating operations"

**The solution**
Used a 'with' block to automatically close the open stream on the file just after it is no longer needed

verification.payload:
tree 404267284574f3afc46d05473138600cb6e27457
parent f91d08f703ee61cf4ae936b9700ca974de2748fe
author Naelson Douglas C. Oliveira <naelson17@gmail.com> 1635440738 -0300
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1635440738 -0500

Don't leak an open file handle; fix Pyling R1732 (#584)

**The problem**
The code had a case of a manual file handler pitfall, where a resource stream is opened manually and never closed.

This pitfall was detected using Pyling, which triggered a message of code R1732 with the content "Consider using 'with' for resource-allocating operations"

**The solution**
Used a 'with' block to automatically close the open stream on the file just after it is no longer needed

commit.message:
July-August 2021 Fixes (#538)

## Summary of the Pull Request

This includes two fixes:
- [x] Closes #500 
Changes the build process to use gftools.stat instead of statmake. The issue was caused by an 'unused' italic axis in the fonts, which has been removed, but statmake gets unhappy without it there. So the process has been adjusted to a more amenable build library. 

- [x] Closes #552
Adds the Hebrew language tag to the Regular to ensure that Hebrew positioning works correctly. 

Also:
Adjusts calt feature to ensure LIG substitutions properly function under rare conditions where the `ignore` activate incorrectly. I thought this had already been PR'd but seems not. 

For example:
`===]`
First = becomes "equal_equal.liga", and ignore would activate on second =, blocking LIG from being substituted. If the liga form appears, LIG should appear.

Turned back on the =>> =<<, etc. ligatures as there is a glyph for them now.

verification.payload:
tree e74b1c7ebd7f95e5eee0b1bb6ba8bdbe2c9c2433
parent 99b4974739013cc9792352d7f8dde8662f7d9ccd
author Aaron <aaronbell@users.noreply.github.com> 1630004285 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1630004285 -0500

July-August 2021 Fixes (#538)

## Summary of the Pull Request

This includes two fixes:
- [x] Closes #500 
Changes the build process to use gftools.stat instead of statmake. The issue was caused by an 'unused' italic axis in the fonts, which has been removed, but statmake gets unhappy without it there. So the process has been adjusted to a more amenable build library. 

- [x] Closes #552
Adds the Hebrew language tag to the Regular to ensure that Hebrew positioning works correctly. 

Also:
Adjusts calt feature to ensure LIG substitutions properly function under rare conditions where the `ignore` activate incorrectly. I thought this had already been PR'd but seems not. 

For example:
`===]`
First = becomes "equal_equal.liga", and ignore would activate on second =, blocking LIG from being substituted. If the liga form appears, LIG should appear.

Turned back on the =>> =<<, etc. ligatures as there is a glyph for them now.

commit.message:
Updating README and other small fixes (#519)

Updating the README page to better talk about font features, describe how to access the stylistic sets, and provide more information about the font front-and-center.

Additionally, I located a few graphic glyphs with rotated components that have now been replaced with basic, non-rotated versions (no impact on rendering).

Fixing the image samples on the main page (it appears it was using an older version of the font). Also found a couple of bugs in the source for the graphical squares (wherein the components are mirrored). This has no impact on font output but is better for the source.

commit.message:
Add Hebrew and Arabic; rework Italic (#511)

Major update! 

This update includes the brand new Arabic and Hebrew language coverage,
along with a variety of bug fixes to the upright and italic fonts. There
has also been a major overhaul of the Cascadia Code Italic lowercase to
make the forms align better with our vision for the font. Enjoy :). 

Supersedes #491

Cascadia Code
* [x] Closes #84 - Arabic language support added!
* [x] Closes #465 - Hebrew language support added!
* [x] Closes #499 - Adjusted base mark positions / set others to be
  ignored in propagateAnchors

Cascadia Code Italic
* [x] Closes #470 - Adjusted slant on cursive forms to feel a bit better
* [x] Closes #468 - Moved cursive forms to `ss01` / `salt` feature 
* [x] Closes #507 - Changed bar / broken bar to be upright for better
  clarity. All ligature forms adjusted.

Both
* [x] Closes #494 - Adjusted `∆í` in both upright and italic

- Arabic (and Urdu) support added (design by Mohamad Dakak). See [the
  Arabic features PDF] for the exciting new Arabic ligature
  functionality used in Cascadia Code that gives the font greatly
  improved readability and feel more more akin to a text typeface. Don't
  want all that? Don't worry, Cascadia Mono will house a normal version
  of Arabic. 

- Hebrew support added (design by Liron Lavi Turkenich)
- Fixing a bug in the ccmp feature file and added ccmp to the feature
  set in the build script.
- Deleting the (unused) liga feature file
- Vika has reviewed and improved some forms in Cascadia Code upright. 
- /f, /l, /s, /r (and related forms) have been updated to follow more
  'generic' forms. Previous versions have been moved to ss01 / salt OT
  features.

- Changed design of `∆í` in upright to align better with the standard
  `f`. In the italic, the `∆í` has been changed to follow the cursive
  version. When `ss01` is applied, the design of the `f` and `∆í` are
  swapped, and if the `locl` EWE language setting is applied, the 'f'
  swaps for a straight descender version (with cursive `∆í`).
  Complicated, but achieves supporting everything.

- Entry and exit strokes across the italic lowercase have been rounded
  to better achieve the fun / playful design language that we intended
  for the italic. Other skeletons have been modified as necessary.
  Cyrillic has also been updated for better consistency with the new
  design. 

- Greek lowercase has been updated per feedback from Gerry Leonidas to
  be more cohesive (No longer a mix between a Monday and Friday font.
  All Friday, all the time)

## Validation Steps Performed
All updated reviewed, hinted, and reviewed again :)

[the Arabic features PDF]: https://github.com/microsoft/cascadia-code/blob/main/doc/Arabic_KeyFeatures.pdf

verification.payload:
tree 2b623c06da57c872623a0f6d3d250e51b53de481
parent b0a6b2a22f13f5a841350cbf8de70d0962399a8d
author Aaron <aaronbell@users.noreply.github.com> 1624037823 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1624037823 -0500

Major update! 

This update includes the brand new Arabic and Hebrew language coverage,

* [x] Closes #465 - Hebrew language support added!

* [x] Closes #507 - Changed bar / broken bar to be upright for better

- Arabic (and Urdu) support added (design by Mohamad Dakak). See [the
  Arabic features PDF] for the exciting new Arabic ligature

  of Arabic.

- Fixing a bug in the ccmp feature file and added ccmp to the feature
  set in the build script.
- Deleting the (unused) liga feature file
- Vika has reviewed and improved some forms in Cascadia Code upright. 
- /f, /l, /s, /r (and related forms) have been updated to follow more
  'generic' forms. Previous versions have been moved to ss01 / salt OT
  features.

- Changed design of `∆í` in upright to align better with the standard
  `f`. In the italic, the `∆í` has been changed to follow the cursive
  version. When `ss01` is applied, the design of the `f` and `∆í` are
  swapped, and if the `locl` EWE language setting is applied, the 'f'
  swaps for a straight descender version (with cursive `∆í`).
  Complicated, but achieves supporting everything.

- Entry and exit strokes across the italic lowercase have been rounded
  to better achieve the fun / playful design language that we intended
  for the italic. Other skeletons have been modified as necessary.
  Cyrillic has also been updated for better consistency with the new
  design. 

- Greek lowercase has been updated per feedback from Gerry Leonidas to
  be more cohesive (No longer a mix between a Monday and Friday font.
  All Friday, all the time)

All updated reviewed, hinted, and reviewed again :)

commit.message:
Cascadia Code Upright bugfixes (#482)

A large set of bug fixes identified while working on the Italic, but solving
Github reported issues. 

## PR Checklist
- [x] Closes #422 - Bitcoin added
- [x] Closes #427 - FFFD glyph added
- [x] Closes #418 - top bar corrected
- [x] Closes #433 - hinting corrected to ensure alignment
- [x] Closes #435 - adds consistent ligature form for `=>>` `<<=` `=<<` and
  `>>=` (the infinite arrows still work with addition of more equals)
- [x] Closes #443 - ligature now ignores (*) scenario
- [x] Closes #454 - adds ignore to prevent equal_equal ligature from showing up
- [x] Closes #467 - Not specifically sure of the problem here, but suspect that
  it will be fixed with this - update.
- [x] Closes #477 - fixed
- [x] Closes #478 - fixed
- [x] Closes #479 - fixed
- [x] Closes #480 - fixed
- [x] Closes #481 - JetBrains enumerates fonts weird. I've modified the
  internal naming so that it will register Cascadia Code correctly. Also
  aligned postscript naming with Google's recommendation, so will show up as
  "Regular" instead of "Roman". Still works in Word!


Other Cascadia Code fixes:
- General improvement of weight balancing
- Weight of lowercase rounds reduced in the Bold weight in Cascadia Code.
- Weight of Capital stems increased in Extralight weight in Cascadia Code. 
- Tweaked weight of ogonek in ExtraLight.
- Added a localized form for ƒ≥ and ƒ≤ should a user chose to use those
  codepoints and want an accented version.
- Split fraction bar at heavier weights to improve clarity of fractions.
- Adjusted standard box drawing characters to align with GDI metrics, and added
  a complete set of DWrite-specific ones that align with sTypo (using `rclt`).
- Ironed out some tiny inconsistencies in the <$ $> <$> ligatures which I'm
  sure no one will ever notice. 
- Fixed centering of braces and some hyphens.
- Fixed inconsistency between semicolon/colon and period weight in bold. Also
  fixed slight differences in hyphen-like glyphs in bold. You're as surprised
  as I am. 
- Increased weight of underscore in bold.
- Adjusted weighting of ‚±¢.
- Changed design of commaaccent, commaaccentmod commaturnedabove and commaabove
  to be more distinguishable (following design of quotes).
- Increased height of Œ≤Œ¥Œ∏Œª to align with the ascender height. They were too low
  before. 
- Fixed descents of various greek lowercase glyphs that were inconsistent. 
- Modified Œæ weighting. 
- Felt ligated, might edit later.
- Tweaked ¬™¬∫‚Åø ∑ ∏·∂ø·∂ª‚Å∞¬π¬≤¬≥‚Å¥‚Åµ‚Å∂‚Å∑‚Å∏‚Åπ in imperceptable ways. 
- Corrected some additional interpolation bugs

I do enjoy giving Dustin presents.

verification.payload:
tree bbb6e56ea7b835a36f468d7afb81ae3be38601ed
parent 253234d8025b542a2c02892c51eccc9963f4da59
author Aaron <aaronbell@users.noreply.github.com> 1622228621 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1622228621 -0500

A large set of bug fixes identified while working on the Italic, but solving

## PR Checklist

- [x] Closes #435 - adds consistent ligature form for `=>>` `<<=` `=<<` and
  `>>=` (the infinite arrows still work with addition of more equals)

- [x] Closes #454 - adds ignore to prevent equal_equal ligature from showing up
- [x] Closes #467 - Not specifically sure of the problem here, but suspect that
  it will be fixed with this - update.
- [x] Closes #477 - fixed
- [x] Closes #478 - fixed
- [x] Closes #479 - fixed
- [x] Closes #480 - fixed
- [x] Closes #481 - JetBrains enumerates fonts weird. I've modified the
  internal naming so that it will register Cascadia Code correctly. Also
  aligned postscript naming with Google's recommendation, so will show up as
  "Regular" instead of "Roman". Still works in Word!


Other Cascadia Code fixes:
- General improvement of weight balancing
- Weight of lowercase rounds reduced in the Bold weight in Cascadia Code.
- Weight of Capital stems increased in Extralight weight in Cascadia Code. 
- Tweaked weight of ogonek in ExtraLight.
- Added a localized form for ƒ≥ and ƒ≤ should a user chose to use those
  codepoints and want an accented version.
- Split fraction bar at heavier weights to improve clarity of fractions.
- Adjusted standard box drawing characters to align with GDI metrics, and added
  a complete set of DWrite-specific ones that align with sTypo (using `rclt`).
- Ironed out some tiny inconsistencies in the <$ $> <$> ligatures which I'm
  sure no one will ever notice. 
- Fixed centering of braces and some hyphens.
- Fixed inconsistency between semicolon/colon and period weight in bold. Also
  fixed slight differences in hyphen-like glyphs in bold. You're as surprised
  as I am. 
- Increased weight of underscore in bold.
- Adjusted weighting of ‚±¢.
- Changed design of commaaccent, commaaccentmod commaturnedabove and commaabove
  to be more distinguishable (following design of quotes).
- Increased height of Œ≤Œ¥Œ∏Œª to align with the ascender height. They were too low
  before. 
- Fixed descents of various greek lowercase glyphs that were inconsistent. 
- Modified Œæ weighting. 
- Felt ligated, might edit later.
- Tweaked ¬™¬∫‚Åø ∑ ∏·∂ø·∂ª‚Å∞¬π¬≤¬≥‚Å¥‚Åµ‚Å∂‚Å∑‚Å∏‚Åπ in imperceptable ways. 
- Corrected some additional interpolation bugs

I do enjoy giving Dustin presents.
